title: Health and Human Services Amendments

history.action: Bill Numbered but not Distributed in Legislative Research and General Counsel
Numbered Bill Publicly Distributed in Legislative Research and General Counsel
House/ received bill from Legislative Research in Clerk of the House
House/ 1st reading (Introduced) in House Rules Committee

general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to the Department of Health and Human Services.
hilighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>repeals outdated language;<hr><ltbullet>updates code references;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the Department of Health and Human Services (department) may examine and audit the expenditures of public funds provided to a local health department;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the required qualifications for the department's executive director and deputy directors;<hr><ltbullet>updates the name of a division and an office within the department;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the executive director of the department may create committees within the department, subject to certain conditions and requirements;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the department to access certain records of individuals licensed or certified by the Division of Professional Licensing for specific purposes;<hr><ltbullet>adds additional items to the list of duties of the department;<hr><ltbullet>updates language to be consistent with the transfer of certain emergency medical services responsibilities from the department to the Department of Public Safety;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the administration of stock albuterol by a qualified adult;<hr><ltbullet>updates references from "targeted case management" to "case managers";<hr><ltbullet>provides that the Division of Services for People with Disabilities must determine the most appropriate, least restrictive setting for an individual with an intellectual disability within the division's system;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions regarding fetal death certificates and certificates of early term stillbirth;<hr><ltbullet>updates code references to reflect the current name of the Office of Substance Use and Mental Health within the department;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Office of Recovery Services to review child support guidelines and submit a summary of the review to the Judiciary Interim Committee; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

action_history.description: House/ received bill from Legislative Research
